snippet: The Pentagon’s inspector general is examining claims that senior military officers manipulated conclusions about progress against the Islamic State.
abstract: Intelligence analysts provide Pentagon investigators with evidence that top military officers at United States Central Command, or Centcom, manipulated reports on military campaign against Islamic State; say military officials sought to alter conclusions on success of operations; lawmakers express concern that key decisions in campaign were based on false information.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and MATT APUZZO

lead_paragraph: The Pentagon’s inspector general is examining claims that senior military officers manipulated conclusions about progress against the Islamic State.

headline.main: Analysts Detail Claims That Reports on ISIS Were Distorted
headline.print_headline: New Evidence in U.S. Inquiry on ISIS Data

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
